moves.shortEffect: Poisons the target.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.effect: Paralyzes the target.
moves.shortEffect: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.
moves.shortEffect: Badly poisons the target, inflicting more damage every turn.

moves.name: Screech
moves.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.effect: Confuses the target.
moves.shortEffect: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.effect: Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.  If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.  brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.
moves.shortEffect: Reduces damage from special attacks by 50% for five turns.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.effect: Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.  If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.  brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.
moves.shortEffect: Reduces damage from physical attacks by half.

moves.name: Swift
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
moves.shortEffect: Never misses.

moves.name: Spore
moves.effect: Puts the target to sleep.
moves.shortEffect: Puts the target to sleep.

moves.name: Rest
moves.effect: User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.  This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.
moves.shortEffect: User sleeps for two turns, completely healing itself.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.effect: Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.  The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.  The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.  Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.  It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.  The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.  life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.  The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.  The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.  All other effects work as normal.
moves.shortEffect: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.

moves.name: Protect
moves.effect: No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.  thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.  The following effects are not prevented by this move:  * acupressure from an ally * curse's curse effect * Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn * feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits * imprison * perish song * shadow force * Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents any moves from hitting the user this turn.

moves.name: Scary Face
moves.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Mud Slap
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.effect: Scatters spikes around the opposing field, which damage opposing Pokémon that enter the field for 1/8 of their max HP.  Pokémon immune to ground moves are immune to this damage, except during gravity.  Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.  wonder guard does not block damage from this effect.  rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.
moves.shortEffect: Scatters Spikes, hurting opposing Pokémon that switch in.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
moves.shortEffect: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

moves.name: Endure
moves.effect: The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents the user's HP from lowering below 1 this turn.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.  This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.  If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.effect: Changes the user's and target's remaining HP to the average of their current remaining HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect does not count as inflicting damage for other moves and effects that respond to damage taken.  This effect fails against a substitute.
moves.shortEffect: Sets the user's and targets's HP to the average of their current HP.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.effect: Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.  If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.  thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.  solar beam has half power.  moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.  Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.  Pokémon with forecast become water.  Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the weather to rain for five turns.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.effect: Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.  assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.  bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.
moves.shortEffect: For the next few turns, the target can only use damaging moves.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.  Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.  If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.
moves.shortEffect: Target drops its held item.

moves.name: Bullet Seed
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.  Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
moves.shortEffect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Mud Shot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: Magical Leaf
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
moves.shortEffect: Never misses.

moves.name: Toxic Spikes
moves.effect: Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.  If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.  rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.  This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.  Pokémon entering the field due to baton pass are not affected by this effect.
moves.shortEffect: Scatters poisoned spikes, poisoning opposing Pokémon that switch in.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Earth Power
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
moves.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.

moves.name: Flash Cannon
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.effect: For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.  Pokémon holding full incense, lagging tail, or quick claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.
moves.shortEffect: For five turns, slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.

moves.name: Leaf Storm
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Power Whip
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.  Target's weight | Power --------------- | ----: Up to 10kg      |    20 Up to 25kg      |    40 Up to 50kg      |    60 Up to 100kg     |    80 Up to 200kg     |   100 Above 200kg     |   120
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage to heavier targets, with a maximum of 120 power.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts double damage if the target is Poisoned.

moves.name: Acid Spray
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage is calculated using the target's attacking stat rather than the user's.
moves.shortEffect: Calculates damage with the target's attacking stat.

moves.name: Hex
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has a major status ailment, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Has double power if the target has a major status ailment.

moves.name: Reflect Type
moves.effect: User's type changes to match the target's.
moves.shortEffect: User becomes the target's type.

moves.name: Grassy Terrain
moves.effect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 their max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.  Changes nature power to energy ball.
moves.shortEffect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.

moves.name: Dazzling Gleam
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Lunge
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Grassy Glide
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Skitter Smack
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

flavorTextEntries: These pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

name: Klawf

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.effect: Moves cannot score critical hits against this Pokémon.  This ability functions identically to battle armor.
abilities.shortEffect: Protects against critical hits.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.effect: This Pokémon regains 1/3 of its maximum HP when it is switched out for another Pokémon under any circumstances other than having fainted.  This ability does not take effect when a battle ends.
abilities.shortEffect: Heals for 1/3 max HP upon switching out.

moves.name: Guillotine
moves.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.  Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.  The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
moves.shortEffect: Causes a one-hit KO.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
moves.shortEffect: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
moves.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.

moves.name: Rock Throw
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Dig
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.  The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.  This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: User digs underground, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.

moves.name: Harden
moves.effect: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Crabhammer
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
moves.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Rest

It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Thief
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.  Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.  The target cannot recover its item with recycle.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Takes the target's item.

moves.name: Flail
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.  64 * current HP / max HP | Power -----------------------: | ----:  0– 1                    |  200  2– 5                    |  150  6–12                    |  100 13–21                    |   80 22–42                    |   40 43–64                    |   20
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user has less HP remaining, with a maximum of 200 power.

moves.name: Reversal
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.  64 * current HP / max HP | Power -----------------------: | ----:  0– 1                    |  200  2– 5                    |  150  6–12                    |  100 13–21                    |   80 22–42                    |   40 43–64                    |   20
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user has less HP remaining, with a maximum of 200 power.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.  Pokémon cannot become frozen.  thunder has 50% accuracy.  solar beam skips its charge turn.  moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.  Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.  Pokémon with forecast become fire.  Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects. Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.  Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.

moves.name: Ancient Power
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by one stage.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.effect: Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Ally's next move inflicts half more damage.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Destroys Reflect and Light Screen.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.  Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.  If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.
moves.shortEffect: Target drops its held item.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's HP to equal the user's.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: Iron Defense
moves.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

moves.name: Mud Shot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: Rock Blast
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.  Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
moves.shortEffect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.  This move ignores sticky hold.  If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.
moves.shortEffect: Throws held item at the target; power depends on the item.

moves.name: X Scissor
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Power Gem
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Earth Power
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
moves.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
moves.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
moves.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Stealth Rock
moves.effect: Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.  rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.
moves.shortEffect: Causes damage when opposing Pokémon switch in.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.  If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.  This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.
moves.shortEffect: Removes any immunity to Ground damage.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: High Horsepower
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Throat Chop
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Silences the target for two turns, preventing it from using any sound-based moves.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents the target from using sound-based moves for two turns.

moves.name: Stomping Tantrum
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power is doubled if the user's last move failed for any reason (i.e., produced the message "But it failed!") or was ineffective due to types.
moves.shortEffect: Has double power if the user's last move failed.

moves.name: Meteor Beam
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Skitter Smack
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

flavorTextEntries: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
This pokémon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents’ attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.

name: Capsakid

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.effect: This Pokémon's Speed is doubled during strong sunlight.  This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.
abilities.shortEffect: Doubles Speed during strong sunlight.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.effect: This Pokémon cannot be asleep.  This causes rest to fail altogether.  If a Pokémon is asleep and acquires this ability, it will immediately wake up; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.  This ability functions identically to vital spirit in battle.
abilities.shortEffect: Prevents sleep.

abilities.name: Klutz
abilities.effect: In battle, this Pokémon cannot use its held item, nor will the item have any passive effect on the battle, positive or negative.  This Pokémon also cannot use fling.  The Speed cut from the iron ball and the effort items (the macho brace, power weight, power bracer, power belt, power lens, power band, and power anklet) is unaffected.  Items that do not directly affect the battle, such as the exp share, the amulet coin, or the soothe bell, work as usual.  All held items work as usual out of battle.  Other moves that use the held item, such as natural gift and switcheroo, work as usual.
abilities.shortEffect: Prevents the Pokémon from using its held item in battle.
effectChanges: fling can be used as usual.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
moves.shortEffect: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

moves.name: Leer
moves.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Bite
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Leech Seed
moves.effect: Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.  The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid ooze.  rapid spin will remove this effect.  This effect is passed on by baton pass.
moves.shortEffect: Seeds the target, stealing HP from it every turn.

moves.name: Growth
moves.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.  During sunny day, raises both stats by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage.

moves.name: Razor Leaf
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
moves.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.  During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.  During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.  This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: Requires a turn to charge before attacking.

moves.name: Rest
moves.effect: User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.  This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.
moves.shortEffect: User sleeps for two turns, completely healing itself.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.effect: Inflicts typeless damage equal to half the target's remaining HP.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts damage equal to half the target's HP.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.effect: Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.  The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.  The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.  Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.  It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.  The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.  life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.  The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.  The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.  All other effects work as normal.
moves.shortEffect: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.

moves.name: Thief
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.  Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.  The target cannot recover its item with recycle.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Takes the target's item.

moves.name: Protect
moves.effect: No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.  thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.  The following effects are not prevented by this move:  * acupressure from an ally * curse's curse effect * Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn * feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits * imprison * perish song * shadow force * Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents any moves from hitting the user this turn.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.effect: Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.  solar beam's power is halved.  moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
moves.shortEffect: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

moves.name: Endure
moves.effect: The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents the user's HP from lowering below 1 this turn.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.  If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.  This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.  If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.effect: Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.  If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.  Pokémon cannot become frozen.  thunder has 50% accuracy.  solar beam skips its charge turn.  moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.  Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.  Pokémon with forecast become fire.  Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.  Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.  Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.  Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.effect: Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Ally's next move inflicts half more damage.

moves.name: Ingrain
moves.effect: Prevents the user from switching out.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP at the end of every turn.  If the user was immune to ground attacks, it will now take normal damage from them.  roar and whirlwind will not affect the user.  The user cannot use magnet rise.  The user may still use u turn to leave the field.  This effect can be passed with baton pass.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents the user from leaving battle.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP every turn.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's HP to equal the user's.

moves.name: Bullet Seed
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.  Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
moves.shortEffect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Magical Leaf
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
moves.shortEffect: Never misses.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.effect: Changes the target's ability to insomnia.  If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the target's ability to Insomnia.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Leaf Storm
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.  Target's weight | Power --------------- | ----: Up to 10kg      |    20 Up to 25kg      |    40 Up to 50kg      |    60 Up to 100kg     |    80 Up to 200kg     |   100 Above 200kg     |   120
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage to heavier targets, with a maximum of 120 power.

moves.name: Rage Powder
moves.effect: Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.  This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.  If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Redirects the target's single-target effects to the user for this turn.

moves.name: Grassy Terrain
moves.effect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 their max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.  Changes nature power to energy ball.
moves.shortEffect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.

moves.name: Leafage
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Stomping Tantrum
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power is doubled if the user's last move failed for any reason (i.e., produced the message "But it failed!") or was ineffective due to types.
moves.shortEffect: Has double power if the user's last move failed.

moves.name: Grassy Glide
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

flavorTextEntries: The more sunlight this pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
Traditional paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of capsakid among their ingredients.

moves.shortEffect: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.effect: Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.  If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.  Pokémon cannot become frozen.  thunder has 50% accuracy.  solar beam skips its charge turn.  moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.  Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.  Pokémon with forecast become fire.  Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.  Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.  Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.  Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Will O Wisp
moves.effect: Burns the target.
moves.shortEffect: Burns the target.

moves.name: Facade
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.effect: Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Ally's next move inflicts half more damage.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's HP to equal the user's.

moves.name: Overheat
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Bullet Seed
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.  Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
moves.shortEffect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Magical Leaf
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
moves.shortEffect: Never misses.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.effect: Changes the target's ability to insomnia.  If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.
moves.shortEffect: Changes the target's ability to Insomnia.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
moves.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.

moves.name: Fire Fang
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Leaf Storm
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.  Target's weight | Power --------------- | ----: Up to 10kg      |    20 Up to 25kg      |    40 Up to 50kg      |    60 Up to 100kg     |    80 Up to 200kg     |   100 Above 200kg     |   120
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage to heavier targets, with a maximum of 120 power.

moves.name: Grassy Terrain
moves.effect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 their max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.  Changes nature power to energy ball.
moves.shortEffect: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.

moves.name: Leafage
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Stomping Tantrum
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power is doubled if the user's last move failed for any reason (i.e., produced the message "But it failed!") or was ineffective due to types.
moves.shortEffect: Has double power if the user's last move failed.

moves.name: Grassy Glide
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Burning Jealousy
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Lash Out
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

flavorTextEntries: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

name: Rellor

abilities.name: Compound Eyes
abilities.effect: This Pokémon's moves have 1.3× their accuracy.  This ability has no effect on the one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold).  Overworld: If the first Pokémon in the party has this ability, the chance of a wild Pokémon holding a particular item is raised from 50%, 5%, or 1% to 60%, 20%, or 5%, respectively.
abilities.shortEffect: Increases moves' accuracy to 1.3×.
effectChanges: Has no overworld effect.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.effect: After each turn, this Pokémon has a 33% of being cured of any major status ailment.
abilities.shortEffect: Has a 33% chance of curing any major status ailment after each turn.
effectChanges: Chance of taking effect is 30%.
Chance of taking effect is 33%.

moves.name: Sand Attack
moves.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
moves.shortEffect: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

moves.name: Dig
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.  The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.  This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: User digs underground, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.

moves.name: Recover
moves.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.
moves.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.effect: Raises user's Defense by one stage.  After this move is used, the power of ice ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.
moves.shortEffect: Raises user's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Leech Life
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
moves.shortEffect: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

moves.name: Rest
moves.effect: User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.  This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.
moves.shortEffect: User sleeps for two turns, completely healing itself.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.effect: Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.  The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.  The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.  Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.  It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.  The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.  life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.  The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.  The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.  All other effects work as normal.
moves.shortEffect: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.

moves.name: Thief
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.  Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.  The target cannot recover its item with recycle.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Takes the target's item.

moves.name: Protect
moves.effect: No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.  thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.  The following effects are not prevented by this move:  * acupressure from an ally * curse's curse effect * Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn * feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits * imprison * perish song * shadow force * Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents any moves from hitting the user this turn.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Mud Slap
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

moves.name: Endure
moves.effect: The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.  If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.  This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
moves.shortEffect: Prevents the user's HP from lowering below 1 this turn.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.  If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.  This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.  If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.  This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
moves.shortEffect: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.

moves.name: Memento
moves.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.

moves.name: Facade
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
moves.shortEffect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Weather Ball
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a weather move is active, this move has double power, and its type becomes the type of the weather move.  shadow sky is typeless for the purposes of this move.
moves.shortEffect: If there be weather, this move has doubled power and the weather's type.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: Cosmic Power
moves.effect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Iron Defense
moves.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
moves.shortEffect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

moves.name: Mud Shot
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

moves.name: Fling
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.  This move ignores sticky hold.  If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.
moves.shortEffect: Throws held item at the target; power depends on the item.

moves.name: X Scissor
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

moves.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Bug Bite
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.  If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.  If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.
moves.shortEffect: If target has a berry, inflicts double damage and uses the berry.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

moves.name: Lunge
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
moves.shortEffect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage.

moves.name: Skitter Smack
moves.effect: Inflicts regular damage.
moves.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

flavorTextEntries: This pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.

name: Rabsca

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.effect: Whenever this Pokémon is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, the Pokémon who gave this Pokémon that ailment is also given the ailment.  This ability passes back bad poison when this Pokémon is badly poisoned.  This ability cannot pass on a status ailment that the Pokémon did not directly receive from another Pokémon, such as the poison from toxic spikes or the burn from a flame orb.  Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, wild Pokémon have a 50% chance of having the lead Pokémon's nature, and a 50% chance of being given a random nature as usual, including the lead Pokémon's nature.  This does not work on Pokémon received outside of battle or roaming legendaries.
abilities.shortEffect: Copies burns, paralysis, and poison received onto the Pokémon that inflicted them.
effectChanges: Has no overworld effect.
Cannot influence the natures of Pokémon encountered by interacting with them on the overworld.
Passes back bad poison as regular poison.
